subText: We learned about budgeting in our previous classes. This requires attentive consideration to decide how the money we have should be spent on the things we need.  For example, if you’ve $50, you’d first prioritise school items (sharpener and so on) over everything else such as buying items for hobbies and personal items.
Planning is an important task as it lets us get ahead. This can include making shopping lists, doing research on cost of items, deciding how to spend your money on what on a yearly basis.
Being organized involves budgeting and planning, but overall ensures that we execute our plan wisely. For example, you can check items off your to-do list in a timely manner.

Spending money wisely is an art. It requires attention, consideration, and the ability to say no to impulsive purchases. For example, when you pass a toy shop while going to buy ice-cream, you should say no to changing your mind to buy a toy instead.

When you get an allowance either on a monthly basis or on celebrations, be sure to keep some aside on a regular basis! You can use a piggy bank to do the same. For example, you can get assistance from your parents or grandparents in this regard.
